personas.name: Marcus (Sales Agent)
personas.description: High-performing closer conducting 3-5 calls per day. Experienced with direct sales but new to structured call methodology. Motivated by close rates and commission.
goals: Execute consistent, high-quality calls with minimal variance
Close more qualified deals with better-aligned prospects
Build confidence in objection handling through diagnostic approach
Speed up call preparation and execution
Get immediate feedback on call quality
pain_points: Objection handling often becomes defensive argumentation
Lack of structured guidance during calls causes uncertainty
Post-call insights take too long to access
Inconsistent close rates across different prospect types
Fear of forgetting important qualification checks
personas.context: Works from home office, uses Zoom for all calls, multi-tasking between CRM and notes. Needs quick, intuitive interface. Values speed and immediate guidance.

personas.name: Sabine (Sales Manager)
personas.description: Team lead responsible for 4-6 sales agents. Focused on coaching, variance reduction, and forecast accuracy. Needs visibility into team performance and individual development opportunities.
goals: Reduce variance in call execution across team
Spot patterns in objection handling and prospect fit
Track pipeline progression and conversion rates
Validate that system-guided calls improve outcomes
Coach agents using actual call data
pain_points: Difficult to identify root causes of call failures
Limited visibility into what happens during calls
Manual analysis of call quality is time-consuming
Hard to coach objection handling without recordings
Can't easily compare agent performance fairly
Unclear which prospects need different approaches
personas.context: Weekly 1-1 coaching sessions with agents. Reviews calls async on mobile device. Needs quick insights and drill-down capability.

personas.name: Thomas (Admin)
personas.description: System administrator responsible for platform configuration, milestone tuning, and AI prompt management. Technical background with strong attention to process optimization.
goals: Set up and tune milestone sequences for optimal flow
Configure objection diagnostic questions based on coaching philosophy
Manage AI prompt evolution as patterns emerge
Enable A/B testing of slide decks and messaging
Maintain version control of all system configurations
pain_points: Complex prompt engineering without proper tools
Difficulty testing changes before rolling out
No clear way to measure effectiveness of variations
Risk of breaking existing flows with changes
Hard to roll back if changes have unintended effects
personas.context: Works during standard business hours, needs to coordinate with coaches. Uses desktop for complex config tasks. Values stability and traceability.

journeys.name: First Call Journey (Marcus - Sales Agent)
journeys.description: Complete first sales call experience from preparation through post-call analysis. Includes onboarding, pre-call setup, milestone execution, objection handling, and AI feedback.

phases.name: Pre-Call Preparation
phases.description: Marcus reviews qualification requirements and completes mandatory pre-call checklist to ensure readiness.

touchpoints.name: Dashboard - New Call Button
touchpoints.description: Agent clicks 'New Call' from dashboard or selects scheduled call from calendar
pain_points: Need to remember all qualification checks

touchpoints.name: Pre-Call Checklist
touchpoints.description: System displays mandatory 8-item checklist: qualification review, client count, business type, revenue, main pain, tool stack, ROI tool, time block
pain_points: Worry about missing critical qualification signals
opportunities: Show real example of missed qualification

touchpoints.name: Qualification Gate Validation
touchpoints.description: System confirms client count >= 500 and blocks coaching pitch if not met. Coaching pitch allowed only for qualified prospects.
pain_points: Frustration when prospect doesn't meet gate

phases.name: M1 Context & Frame (5 min)
phases.description: Marcus establishes diagnostic frame with prospect, setting expectations for call structure and outcome.

touchpoints.name: Milestone Objective Display
touchpoints.description: Clear objective for M1: 'Establish shared understanding of call scope and diagnostic intent'
opportunities: Provide script guidance for 3 possible outcomes

touchpoints.name: Control Panel Notes
touchpoints.description: Marcus takes notes on reason for call, confirmed expectations, and any prospect signals during framing
pain_points: Hard to type while speaking to prospect

phases.name: M2 Current State Mapping (15-20 min)
phases.description: Marcus maps prospect's operational reality, capturing client count, revenue volatility, pain points, and psychological load.

touchpoints.name: Current State Data Capture
touchpoints.description: Marcus captures client count (numeric), revenue volatility (1-5 scale), main pain points (multi-select), and notes across 4 coverage areas
pain_points: Complex prospect situations don't fit categories
opportunities: Provide follow-up prompts for each area

touchpoints.name: Auto-Generated Summary
touchpoints.description: System generates factual summary of current state for Marcus to verbalize back to prospect
pain_points: Hard to synthesize all data on the fly
Prospect might feel data was missed

phases.name: M3-M5 Outcome & Solution (40 min)
phases.description: Marcus guides prospect through vision capture (M3), system reality check (M4), and solution mapping (M5).

touchpoints.name: Outcome Vision Capture
touchpoints.description: Marcus captures desired future state and cost of inaction for 12-month horizon
pain_points: Prospects give vague answers about future
Hard to distinguish real vs fantasy
opportunities: Link vision to earlier pain points

touchpoints.name: System Reality Check
touchpoints.description: Marcus covers hidden cost of manual implementation: time required, management overhead, error probability, burnout risk
pain_points: Prospect gets defensive about current setup
Hard to discuss burnout without offending
opportunities: Show data on manual implementation costs

touchpoints.name: Solution Mapping
touchpoints.description: Marcus presents system leverage vs manual execution, CRM integration, automations, and one-system positioning
pain_points: Hard to connect features to their specific pains

phases.name: M6 Offer Presentation (10 min)
phases.description: Marcus presents coaching infrastructure investment with structural framing, emphasizing 12-month implementation and ROI.

touchpoints.name: Price Presentation
touchpoints.description: Price shown once, stop talking. Structural framing as 12-month infrastructure install, not coaching course.
pain_points: Instinct to justify price after silence
Fear of being perceived as expensive

touchpoints.name: ROI Anchoring
touchpoints.description: Optional ROI tool access to re-anchor pricing if needed, showing 6-month payback and 12-month value

phases.name: M7 Decision Point (5 min)
phases.description: Marcus requests explicit decision with three clear options: Proceed, Pause, Decline. Guides using silence.

touchpoints.name: Decision Request
touchpoints.description: Forced choice: Proceed (coaching client), Pause (follow-up needed), Decline (disqualified)
pain_points: Instinct to fill silence is overwhelming

touchpoints.name: Outcome Classification
touchpoints.description: Marcus selects outcome type. If disqualified, mandatory reason selection (500+ clients, cashflow, misalignment, capacity, authority)

phases.name: Objection Handling (Variable)
phases.description: When prospect raises concern at any milestone, Marcus triggers diagnostic objection subflow based on type (Price, Timing, Capacity, Think, Partner, Skepticism).

touchpoints.name: Objection Type Selection
touchpoints.description: Marcus selects objection type from 6-option menu: Price, Timing, Capacity/Time, Need to Think, Partner/Team, Skepticism
opportunities: Clear questions calm the nervous system

touchpoints.name: Price Objection Diagnostic
touchpoints.description: Step 1: 'Compared to what?', Step 2: Classify comparison (software/coaching/income/fear), Step 3: 6-month payback structural check
pain_points: Hard to stay neutral when defensive

touchpoints.name: Objection Outcome
touchpoints.description: Forced outcome selection: Resolved, Deferred, Disqualified. Cannot close objection panel without choice.
pain_points: Disqualified on one objection is hard to accept

phases.name: Post-Call AI Analysis
phases.description: After call ends, AI generates comprehensive analysis with summary, objection classification, decision readiness, risk flags, and follow-up email draft.

touchpoints.name: Call Recording Review
touchpoints.description: System shows call recording link with transcript, timeline markers for milestones/objections/slides

touchpoints.name: AI Summary & Analysis
touchpoints.description: Factual call summary, objection classification breakdown, decision readiness score (0-100), risk flags, agent execution feedback, slide effectiveness signals
pain_points: Hard to know if analysis is accurate

touchpoints.name: AI-Generated Follow-Up Email
touchpoints.description: Editable email draft based on call facts: recap of agreed points, confirmed next steps, no persuasion or urgency language

success_metrics.measurement: All 7 milestones completed with required confirmations
Standard deviation of milestone completion times across agents
All objections classified with outcome recorded
Post-call survey rating of call structure helpfulness

journeys.name: Objection Mastery Journey (Marcus - Sales Agent)
journeys.description: Focused journey on objection handling skill development. Marcus encounters objection, diagnoses it, and learns from AI feedback on approach effectiveness.

phases.name: Objection Encounter
phases.description: Prospect raises concern at any point in call. Marcus recognizes objection and pauses milestone execution.

touchpoints.name: Objection Recognition
touchpoints.description: Marcus hears concern and realizes objection handling is needed. System objection button always visible.
pain_points: Moment of panic when hearing objection

phases.name: Diagnostic Flow Execution
phases.description: Based on objection type, Marcus executes structured diagnostic questions. No persuasion options available.

touchpoints.name: Objection Type Selection
touchpoints.description: Marcus selects from 6 types: Price, Timing, Capacity/Time, Need to Think, Partner/Team, Skepticism
opportunities: Types are clearly defined with examples
Can clarify with prospect during conversation

touchpoints.name: Step-by-Step Diagnostics
touchpoints.description: System displays diagnostic questions one at a time. Marcus asks each question, records response. Only diagnostic questions available (no persuasion).
pain_points: Hard to be natural with script
opportunities: Questions are genuine diagnostic, not sales tactic
Data clarity enables better next steps

touchpoints.name: Guardrails Enforcement
touchpoints.description: System prevents access to rebuttal or persuasion content. Only diagnostic questions, confirmations, and outcome choices available.

phases.name: Outcome Classification
phases.description: Marcus must classify objection outcome before returning to milestone. Forces explicit decision: Resolved, Deferred, or Disqualified.

touchpoints.name: Forced Outcome Selection
touchpoints.description: Cannot proceed without selecting outcome. Deferred objections tracked for follow-up calls.
pain_points: Disqualified on objection is hard to accept

phases.name: Learn from AI Feedback
phases.description: Post-call AI provides feedback on objection handling quality, effectiveness, and patterns. Marcus reviews and identifies improvement areas.

touchpoints.name: Objection Handling Scorecard
touchpoints.description: AI rates objection handling on diagnostic clarity, question quality, prospect engagement, outcome appropriateness

touchpoints.name: Pattern Recognition Dashboard
touchpoints.description: Aggregate view of Marcus's objection patterns: frequency by type, resolution rates, deferred conversion, decision readiness after objection
pain_points: Need to see patterns to improve
Hard to identify own blind spots
opportunities: Own data, shared with manager only
Identifies specific objection type to focus on

success_metrics.measurement: All objections classified with outcome recorded
Percentage of calls where diagnostic questions used vs persuasion attempts
Percentage of deferred objections that resolve in follow-up calls
Agent can identify top 3 objection types they face

journeys.name: Follow-Up Success Journey (Marcus - Sales Agent)
journeys.description: Continuation journey for follow-up calls. Marcus resumes with full previous context, handles unresolved objections, and moves toward close or disqualification.

phases.name: Context Review
phases.description: Marcus selects follow-up call and reviews previous call summary, last milestone, unresolved objections, and decision variables.

touchpoints.name: Follow-Up Call Selection
touchpoints.description: Marcus clicks follow-up from calendar or prospect record. System loads previous call context automatically.
opportunities: No guessing about what was said

touchpoints.name: Previous Summary Review
touchpoints.description: Previous call summary displayed: key facts discussed, prospect's pain points, vision, and current state mapping
pain_points: Prospect might have changed mind on points

touchpoints.name: Unresolved Objections List
touchpoints.description: System displays all deferred objections from previous call: type, content, and current resolution status
pain_points: Deferred objections might be resolved independently
Hard to predict which to address
opportunities: Shows what matters most to prospect

touchpoints.name: Resume Point Selection
touchpoints.description: Marcus chooses: resume at last milestone (continue progressive flow) OR jump to M7 (decision point only)
pain_points: Time pressure might rush resume point
opportunities: Data shows which approach closes better

phases.name: Objection Re-Engagement
phases.description: If previous objections resurface or new ones emerge, Marcus executes diagnostic subflows. Track whether deferred objections resolve or escalate.

touchpoints.name: Objection Status Update
touchpoints.description: For each unresolved objection, Marcus records update: resolved in the interim, evolved, new information, still unresolved
opportunities: Patterns reveal which objection types are true blockers

touchpoints.name: Re-Diagnostic If Needed
touchpoints.description: If objection persists or evolved, Marcus can re-run diagnostic subflow with deeper probe questions
pain_points: Repetitive questioning might feel annoying to prospect
Need new angle on same objection
Decision to disqualify vs continue is tough
opportunities: Deeper questions get to root cause
Data shows if issue is real blocker or just hesitation

phases.name: Approach Adaptation
phases.description: Based on objection evolution and new information, Marcus may adapt messaging or adjust the flow. Flexible vs strict mode impacts this.

touchpoints.name: Milestone Content Refresh
touchpoints.description: Option to refresh milestone content with new data: updated current state, revised vision, new pain points discovered
pain_points: Fear of losing structure with too much flexibility
opportunities: Data shows which updates improve outcomes

phases.name: Close or Disqualify Decision
phases.description: Marcus reaches M7 and requests explicit decision. Follow-up calls have higher success metrics as prospect has had time to consider.

touchpoints.name: Final Decision Request
touchpoints.description: Same M7 framework: Proceed, Pause, Decline. Outcome classification with disqualification reason if applicable.
pain_points: Long delay between calls increases anxiety
Prospect might have been disqualified after first call
opportunities: Data shows which prospects come back

phases.name: Follow-Up Call AI Analysis
phases.description: Post-follow-up AI analysis includes comparison to previous call, progression indicators, and final outcome clarity.

touchpoints.name: Follow-Up Progression Report
touchpoints.description: AI compares follow-up to previous: objections resolved, new objections introduced, decision readiness progression, prospect engagement trend
pain_points: Unclear if follow-up helped or hurt
Disqualification after follow-up feels like failure

success_metrics.measurement: Percentage of follow-up calls resulting in coaching client or deferred to implementation
Percentage of deferred objections that resolve in follow-up
Average duration of follow-up calls (shorter indicates clarity)
Every follow-up call ends with explicit outcome classification

journeys.name: Team Performance Review Journey (Sabine - Manager)
journeys.description: Weekly coaching-focused journey where Sabine accesses team dashboard, identifies patterns, coaches individual agents, and plans iteration.

phases.name: Dashboard Access & Overview
phases.description: Sabine navigates to performance dashboard and reviews team-wide metrics: calls per agent, objection patterns, close rates, milestone variance.

touchpoints.name: Performance Dashboard Load
touchpoints.description: Default view shows last week's data: 6 agents, total calls, conversion metrics, risk flags summary

touchpoints.name: Team Metrics Overview
touchpoints.description: Calls per agent (showing distribution), objection frequency breakdown (by type), close rate by qualification level, average milestone duration variance
opportunities: Fair comparison accounting for prospect quality

phases.name: Pattern Identification
phases.description: Sabine filters by agent, time period, or call outcome to identify coaching opportunities, performance gaps, and success patterns.

touchpoints.name: Agent Performance Drill-Down
touchpoints.description: Click on specific agent to see: call volume trend, close rate vs team average, objection type distribution, milestone variance, risk flags
pain_points: Want to see progression over time

touchpoints.name: Objection Pattern Analysis
touchpoints.description: By agent: frequency of each objection type, resolution rates, deferred-to-close conversion, decision readiness after objection
pain_points: Hard to know where coaching will help most
opportunities: Identifies specific objection type where agent struggles
Shows if issue is diagnostic or emotional management

touchpoints.name: Variance Analysis
touchpoints.description: Milestone duration variance by agent: who is fastest, who takes extra time, is variance correlated with outcome quality
pain_points: Risk of pressuring agents to rush
opportunities: Data shows if fast closer has worse outcomes

phases.name: Call Review & AI Insights
phases.description: Sabine selects specific calls to review: listens to key moments, reads transcript, reviews AI analysis with risk flags and agent feedback.

touchpoints.name: Call Recording Access
touchpoints.description: Select call from agent's list, access recording with timeline markers for milestones, objections, decision point
pain_points: Full call is long to review
Hard to know where to focus
Transcript helps but hard to skim

touchpoints.name: AI Call Analysis Review
touchpoints.description: Summary, objection classification, decision readiness score, risk flags (overpromise, pressure, misalignment), agent execution feedback, evidence markers
pain_points: Hard to translate insights to coaching

touchpoints.name: Evidence-Backed Coaching Notes
touchpoints.description: Sabine can add her own notes linked to specific call moments. Creates coaching conversation preparation.
pain_points: Agent might not remember call details

phases.name: Individual Coaching Session
phases.description: Sabine meets 1-1 with agent (Marcus) to discuss patterns, review specific calls, and plan skill development focus.

touchpoints.name: 1-1 Call Agenda
touchpoints.description: System prepares coaching agenda: top 3 insights from data, objection pattern focus, specific calls to review
pain_points: Hard to focus feedback on highest impact areas

touchpoints.name: Performance Trend Discussion
touchpoints.description: Sabine shares: close rate trend (improving/declining), objection type where agent excels vs struggles, variance improvement, decision readiness progression
pain_points: Trending can highlight weakness that feels personal
Improvement is slow and hard to see
opportunities: Data is objective, not subjective critique

touchpoints.name: Call Replay & Feedback
touchpoints.description: Watch 2-3 key call moments together. Discuss agent's thinking, alternate approaches, what worked, what to practice.
opportunities: Agent often self-critiques harder than manager

touchpoints.name: Coaching Focus & Practice Plan
touchpoints.description: Agree on 1 skill focus for next week: objection type to master, milestone to refine, or variance to reduce. Plan 2-3 practice calls.
pain_points: Too many improvement areas at once
opportunities: Practice calls get extra coaching attention

phases.name: Team Iteration Planning
phases.description: Monthly cycle: Sabine reviews aggregate patterns, identifies if system adjustments (prompts, milestone content, objection flows) would help.

touchpoints.name: Team Pattern Summary
touchpoints.description: Aggregate insights: most common objection type, milestone where most agents struggle, close rate by prospect type, AI risk flag frequency
pain_points: Hard to know if pattern is skill vs system issue

touchpoints.name: System Improvement Recommendations
touchpoints.description: Based on patterns: recommend milestone content update, objection question refinement, slide deck change, or AI prompt adjustment
pain_points: Too many changes at once confuse team
Hard to A/B test on small team

success_metrics.measurement: Standard deviation of milestone duration across 6-agent team
Agent close rate improvement 4 weeks post-coaching
Manager accesses dashboard at least once per week
Manager addresses high-risk calls within 1 business day

journeys.name: System Configuration Journey (Thomas - Admin)
journeys.description: Admin setup and ongoing tuning journey. Thomas configures milestones, objection flows, slide decks, and AI prompts. Tests changes before rollout.

phases.name: Initial Milestone Configuration
phases.description: Thomas sets up 7-milestone sequence: defines titles, objectives, required questions, confirmations, time estimates, and coverage areas.

touchpoints.name: Milestone Creation Interface
touchpoints.description: Admin panel with form for each milestone: title, objective statement, required_questions (JSON), confirmations (JSON), time estimate, order
pain_points: JSON syntax errors cause validation fails
Hard to preview how this looks to agents

touchpoints.name: Milestone Preview
touchpoints.description: Admin sees exactly how milestone will appear to agent: layout, field types, progress indicators, time estimate display
pain_points: Form view vs agent view differs
Hard to catch UX issues in config

touchpoints.name: Milestone Sequencing
touchpoints.description: Define order index (1-7), validate dependencies, ensure logical flow from context through decision point
pain_points: Hard to reorder later without side effects

phases.name: Objection Flow Configuration
phases.description: Thomas configures 6 objection types with diagnostic questions, allowed outcomes, and any prompt overrides.

touchpoints.name: Objection Type Setup
touchpoints.description: For each of 6 types (Price, Timing, Capacity, Think, Partner, Skepticism): define diagnostic_questions array, allowed_outcomes, scope of applicability
pain_points: Question phrasing needs to be neutral
Easy to revert to persuasion-based questions
Testing with real prospects is risky

touchpoints.name: Question Validation
touchpoints.description: System checks objection questions for: neutrality (no leading language), diagnostic intent (not persuasive), clarity, and order logic
pain_points: Need guardrails but not too restrictive
opportunities: AI suggests when language is potentially problematic

touchpoints.name: Outcome Routing
touchpoints.description: Define what happens after each outcome: Resolved (return to milestone), Deferred (flag for follow-up), Disqualified (end call)
pain_points: Some objections might need custom routing

phases.name: AI Prompt Configuration
phases.description: Thomas manages 5-layer prompt system: global (all calls), milestone-specific, objection-specific, slide analysis, and call synthesis prompts.

touchpoints.name: Prompt Registry Access
touchpoints.description: Admin interface showing all prompts organized by scope: global, milestone, objection, slide, synthesis. Each prompt has version, status, language variants
pain_points: Small changes can have big impacts

touchpoints.name: Prompt Editing & Variables
touchpoints.description: Edit prompt text with variable placeholders (e.g., {prospect_name}, {client_count}, {main_pain}). System shows where variables are used.

touchpoints.name: Prompt Testing
touchpoints.description: Run test with sample call data to see AI output. Compare old vs new prompt. Preview what managers will see.
pain_points: Changes might be too subtle to notice
opportunities: Sample data from real calls included

touchpoints.name: Prompt Versioning & Rollback
touchpoints.description: All prompts are versioned. Admin can activate/deprecate versions. Rollback to previous version if new one causes issues.
pain_points: Prompt changes affect all future calls
No way to test A/B on current calls

phases.name: Slide Deck Management
phases.description: Thomas creates canonical slide deck for the product. Defines template, sets parameter slots, manages versions.

touchpoints.name: Slide Template Creation
touchpoints.description: Create slide templates bound to milestones. Define static title/message, identify parameter slots (e.g., {client_count}, {main_pain}), visualization structure
pain_points: Hard to test with live data

touchpoints.name: Parameter Slot Configuration
touchpoints.description: Define parameter slots: which data field maps to which slot, default values, formatting rules (e.g., number to currency, list to bullet points)
pain_points: Data type mismatches cause rendering issues

touchpoints.name: Slide Deck Versioning
touchpoints.description: Bundle slides into versioned decks (v1.0, v2.0). Set deck status: draft, active, deprecated. Old versions retained for call analysis.
pain_points: Hard to migrate calls to new version mid-month
opportunities: Only one active version at a time

phases.name: Testing & Rollout
phases.description: Thomas creates test calls to validate all configurations work together. Rolls out to agents with monitoring.

touchpoints.name: Test Call Execution
touchpoints.description: Create test call with sample prospect data. Execute all 7 milestones, trigger sample objections, review AI output
pain_points: Test data might not represent real complexity
Tedious to manually test every path

touchpoints.name: Configuration Validation Report
touchpoints.description: System generates report: milestones complete, objections configured, prompts active, slide deck ready, no orphaned steps
pain_points: Cascade failures when parts are incomplete

touchpoints.name: Rollout & Monitoring
touchpoints.description: Activate configuration for team. Monitor first 5 calls for errors, broken flows, or unexpected behavior. Rollback if critical issue.
pain_points: First real calls often reveal issues

phases.name: Ongoing Iteration & Learning
phases.description: Monthly review of call data with Sabine (manager) to identify if system adjustments would improve outcomes. A/B test candidate changes.

touchpoints.name: Performance Data Review
touchpoints.description: Monthly aggregate review: team close rates, objection patterns, milestone completion rates, AI risk flags, agent feedback themes
pain_points: Too much data to see patterns
Hard to attribute change to cause

touchpoints.name: System Improvement Hypothesis
touchpoints.description: If data shows pattern (e.g., objection type increasing, milestone taking longer), propose hypothesis for cause and test change
pain_points: Hard to know if change will help
opportunities: Limited to one change per month

touchpoints.name: A/B Test Setup
touchpoints.description: Create test variant: new milestone phrasing, modified objection question, updated slide, or AI prompt change. Run with subset of team for 2 weeks.
pain_points: Test group might feel like guinea pigs
opportunities: Opt-in test group willing to experiment

success_metrics.measurement: Percentage of calls with configuration-related errors
Time from hypothesis to test completion
P-value threshold for A/B test results
Admin rating of config tools usability

optimization_opportunities.title: Streamline Pre-Call Checklist to 5 Items
optimization_opportunities.description: Current 8-item checklist takes 10 minutes. Analysis shows items 6-8 (tool stack, ROI tool, time block) rarely prevent call issues. Reduce to critical 5: qualification review, client count, business type, revenue range, main pain.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: 2-3 minutes faster call start, maintained qualification integrity. Test with 2 agents first.

optimization_opportunities.title: Add Prospect Context Sidebar During Calls
optimization_opportunities.description: Agent often refers to pre-call notes but can't access them easily while screen-sharing. Add persistent sidebar in control panel showing: key facts, qualifying data, previous objections.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Reduced need to pause call for information lookup. Smoother milestone execution. Better continuity in follow-ups.

optimization_opportunities.title: Implement Milestone Time Alerts
optimization_opportunities.description: Data shows M2 often runs 25+ minutes. Add yellow alert at 15 min, red alert at 20 min to help agents recognize when milestone is overrunning.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Milestone variance reduced 10-15%. Agents remain in control of pacing. Better time management across team.

optimization_opportunities.title: Create Objection Handling Confidence Scoring
optimization_opportunities.description: Post-call AI currently rates objection handling on 0-100 scale. Add Marcus-specific guidance showing which objection types (Price, Timing, etc.) he handles best vs where coaching would help.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Agents can self-identify coaching needs. Coaching more targeted. Deferred-to-close rates improve.

optimization_opportunities.title: Add Mobile Dashboard for Managers
optimization_opportunities.description: Sabine currently reviews dashboard on desktop. Mobile-optimized version would enable quick check-ins during day, faster response to risk flags.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Manager can address risk flags within hours instead of next day. Team feels more supported. Better coaching timeliness.

optimization_opportunities.title: Introduce Slide Effectiveness A/B Testing
optimization_opportunities.description: Currently all agents use same slide deck. Thomas could test variant messaging on subset of calls to identify which slides drive higher decision readiness.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Slide deck version 2.0 built on data. Close rates improve. Variant testing becomes standard practice.

optimization_opportunities.title: Implement Call Outcome Predictive Scoring
optimization_opportunities.description: AI could analyze call progress (milestone completion, objection patterns, decision readiness trend) and predict likely outcome before M7.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Agents can adjust approach mid-call if prediction shows low close likelihood. Prevents wasted calls. Improves conversion.

optimization_opportunities.title: Create Team Objection Mastery Leaderboard
optimization_opportunities.description: Monthly ranking of agents by objection handling effectiveness: resolution rate by type, decision readiness after objection, deferred-to-close conversion.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Healthy competition. Peer learning. Agents reference top performer's calls. Team variance decreases faster.

optimization_opportunities.title: Add 'Disqualification Coaching' Feature
optimization_opportunities.description: When agent disqualifies prospect, system prompts: 'Is this truly unrecoverable or comfort-based disqualification?' Coaching reminder on accurate qualification.
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Reduces false disqualifications. Preserves pipeline quality. Prevents losing viable prospects.

optimization_opportunities.title: Build Follow-Up Call Success Playbook
optimization_opportunities.description: Analyze which first-call outcomes convert to coaching clients on follow-up. Create playbook: 'If first call ends with Pause + Price objection, use X approach on follow-up.'
optimization_opportunities.expected_improvement: Follow-up close rates improve 15-25%. Agents know what to expect. Playbook becomes standard methodology.
